results.title: Books and people: the wealth within
results.brief_description: States that education is a continuing process which does not end when school studies are completed. The ways in which the modern public library serves this purpose and meets practical needs in the community are illustrated. The film describes how the Alabama library extension agency operates and how it helps local communities in establishing and strengthening county libraries. Various forms of library services designed to meet special needs in the community are described. These include the use of bookmobiles to bring books, recorded music, and films to outlying rural communities.

results.title: Bookmaker's progress
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Marrin Canell, Barrie Howells and Donald Winkler
results.brief_description: A film on the Quebec publishing scene in general, and on Robert Davies’ Les Editions l’Etincelle in particular. Davies, an Anglophone publishing French books, is attempting to expand into the international marketplace without sacrificing his own integrity. He discusses the difficulties of survival in the limited Quebec book market, and is shown at work in Montreal, Paris and at the Frankfurt Book Fair.

results.title: Booked for safekeeping
results.creator_credit: Stoney Associates and George C. Stoney
results.brief_description: Demonstrates management of mentally ill people who become the responsibility of the police. Discusses treatment on reception, emphasising the need for immediate attention. Shows how to cope with violent or potentially violent patients and stresses the importance of treatment in the first few hours, and discusses the need for medical assistance in gaols.

results.title: Book keeper
results.creator_credit: Richard Chataway, Anifex Pty Ltd and Michael Cusack
results.brief_description: Within the surreal confines of an old-fashioned bookstore, an eccentric proprietor wages a constant battle against time, insects and the occasional customer to maintain his beloved collection of books. Above the dusty store, his crippled Granny waits for him to supply her with a tin of her favourite Irish Stew as she knits and devours televised rock and roll wrestling. Things take a bizarre twist as a mysterious “book-worm” wriggles into Granny’s ear, making her crave the work of T.S. Eliot. Winner, Best Animation, ZOOM! SA Shorts Fest 1999.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Chataway, Anifex Pty Ltd and Michael Cusack

results.title: Book binding
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Printing as a Career”.
Demonstrates book-binding. Pages are machine folded into sections - two types of folding machines are seen in operation; sections are then pressed and the end papers glued. The different sections comprising a book are sewn together; pressing machines round and shoulder the spines which are then glued to receive the cheesecloth; the building in process, in which the shoulders and backs of the books are shaped, is followed by the making and affixing of the cases. After lettering, dust covers are added by hand.

results.title: Book bargain
results.creator_credit: GPO Film Unit and Norman McLaren
results.brief_description: Set inside a printing factory in the mid 1930’s, this film documents the production of the London telephone directory. Commencing with the preparation of blank rolls of paper, the film progresses through each stage of the production until the directory is ready for delivery. Captures the working conditions and technology of a printing factory in Great Britain in the mid 30’s. Made by Norman McLaren while he was working for Britain’s General Post Office in the 1930s, this film is a novel attempt to inject some interest into what may be considered a dull subject.

results.title: Boogie nights
results.creator_credit: John Lyons, Lloyd Levin, New Line Cinema and Paul Thomas Anderson
results.brief_description: Director Paul Thomas Anderson’s second feature is a sprawling, kinetic tribute to the excesses of the 70’s porn industry.”Boogie Nights” follows the rise and fall of Dirk Diggler (Mark Wahlberg), a porn superstar known for his enormous ‘talent’ and loosely based on real life porn actor John Holmes. The film imagines the porn scene as your average dysfuntional family, headed by patriarch Burt Reynolds, an adult film director with lofty ambitions to make quality entertainment. “Boogie Nights” apparent nostalgia for a long gone era is realised via the death of the 16mm porn film, which was replaced by video, a cheaper, mass produced format that changed the industry forever. All this jammed in between one endless party after another, which comes to a sad, abrupt holt once it reaches the 80’s. The excellent ensemble cast includes Julianne Moore, Heather Graham, Don Cheadle, John C. Reilly, William H. Macy, Philip Seymour Hoffman, Luis Guzman, Burt Reynolds, Mark Wahlberg.

results.title: Boogie doodle
results.brief_description: An animated film, made without the use of a camera, in which boogie” played by Albert Ammons and synchronized with “doodle drawn by McLaren, frame by frame directly onto film stock, combine to make a rhythmic, colorfully beguiling film experiment. The main title appears in eight languages.

results.title: Boo Boo monster enters a beauty contest
results.creator_credit: Bill Cleary and Billy Budd Films
results.brief_description: A beautifully animated story about a friendly green monster who tries to change the colour of his skin and who learns he must accept himself as he really is. A rhythmic drum beat enhances the natural rhythm of the verse to which visuals are set. Animated by Tom Golden and Arnie Levey, music performed and composed by Herbert Harris.

results.title: Bonza
results.brief_description: Bonza is quite possibly the funniest Australian short film ever. It’s a look at a family life through the eyes of a blue heeler. Bonza is a family dog. He is a loyal, confident, affectionate and trusting partner to Ted, his wife Bev and their two children Terry and Katherine who all have their own problems. Ted has been retrenched after 23 years with his firm but cannot bring himself to tell his family. Katherine has just come back from a world trip to sort herself out but is no more together. Terry is doing his HSC for the third time and being forced into dentistry but all his interested in is his starring role in his school’s production of ‘Jesus Christ Superstar’. One day Bonza gets into Bev’s sleeping pills …. recriminations are soon flying thick and fast.
